Key Match Events: The game was delayed for several minutes after fans threw objects on the field toward Profar.
Flaherty hit Tatis in the side, leading to a stare from the tempestuous right fielder and words from Profar.
Machado struck out, after which Flaherty appeared to shout a profane taunt at him that led to shouts from both dugouts.
The rest of the game was completed without incident.
Pre-Game Insights: Roberts urged his team to throw the first punch in the series.
Shildt said the Padres will stay classy in San Diego.
Post-Match Reflections: Roberts said the game was ugly and that he wants to wash it away.
Tatis said the Padres' meeting in the dugout was to regroup and remind themselves of who they are as a group.
Shildt said the Padres will be super excited and hungry in San Diego.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The best-of-five series now moves to San Diego's Petco Park.
The Dodgers could be without Freddie Freeman, whose badly sprained ankle led him to leave the game in the sixth inning.
The Padres have home-field advantage now.
Others: The article mentions that the Dodgers fans let the Padres get under their skin and that the Padres' fans will now be poised to retaliate in San Diego.
The article also mentions that the Dodgers fans' actions impossibly turned the Padres' bad actors into the good guys.
